subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Sweep Tuning of AM Radio Band - FWIW
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
Everything is ok by me. It' not like I'm the big expert or something. I 
think everyone needs a varity of methods to use, cuz it seems like 
everything has it's time when it works, and nothing else does. I use other 
stuff as the whim hits, but it might be kinda intuition. I want to play with 
the manual radio method, but I go downstairs, and there sits the 
board....waiting, so I start playing with that, next thing I know it's 
midnight!
The only requirement is a radio with a tuning knob, preferabley non-digital. 
You want a radio that doesn't kill the audio between stations as you tune 
across the band. I was "playinig" just a bit, and it does seem to work 
better with smooth, constant motion while tuning, maybe taking only a few 
seconds to cover the whole band. I was using the "shower" radio in the 
bathroom. I'm gonna have to do some experimenting, maybe I don't need the 
random voltage, maybe just a slow traingle wave would do, so the tuning 
voltage slowly goes up, then slowly down. That would be a piece of cake! No 
finicky noise transisitor would be big plus. I already modified the latest 
board to take an external VT signal (V-oltage-T-uning), that's just adding a 
connector, with a blocking diode to isolate the external voltage from the on 
board VT amp.



Frank
